flawed_nl_solution:
Dana has 15 more pencils than Jayden who has 20, so Dana has 20+15 = <<20+15=53>>53 pencils
Jayden has 20 pencils which is twice as much as Marcus's so Marcus has 20/2 = <<20/2=10>>10 pencils
Dana has 53-10 = <<53-10=43>>43 more pencils than Marcus
#### 43

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 35, not 53. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
